Description: Small fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery wine-jar, the fabric is relatively coarse and contains a number of small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of one line of black-painted hieratic text probably from a label identifying contents, with the end of a cartouche including the name of the Aten.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393441) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393441)
